title: Fix startup routing: navigate to chat after first launch
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

## Problem
On first app launch, user sees ChatList instead of being taken to their new chat.

## Root Cause
Race condition between two initialization paths:

1. `useInitialization.ts:50-57` - On first launch, creates a chat and sets it as current, but doesn't navigate to `/chat/[id]`

2. `index.tsx:14-26` - Checks `if (chats.length === 0)` to create and navigate, but by this point useInitialization already created a chat, so `chats.length === 1` and navigation never happens

## Fix
In `hooks/useInitialization.ts`, after creating the chat on first launch (line 57), add navigation:

```typescript
import { router } from 'expo-router';
// ...
router.push({ pathname: '/chat/[id]', params: { id: newChatId } });
```

## Files
- `hooks/useInitialization.ts` - Add router navigation after chat creation
- `app/(drawer)/index.tsx` - May need cleanup of redundant chat creation logic

title: Artifacts only available when chat has project attached
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

## Goal
Investigate how artifacts currently work and modify them to only be available when a chat has a project attached (similar to how tools work).

## Tasks
1. Investigate current artifact implementation - how are they enabled/displayed?
2. Understand how projects are attached to chats
3. Understand how tools are conditionally shown based on project attachment
4. Implement same pattern for artifacts - only show/enable artifacts when chat has a project

## Context
The user wants artifacts to follow the same visibility pattern as tools - only available when the chat has a project context.
